The Lord of the Rings: A Reader's Companion

wikitext.*:
'''''duin''''' is a [[Sindarin]] word meaning "large river".<ref name=HMN/>
==Etymology==
''duin'' derives from [[Common Elvish]] ''duinē'' ("large river, (liable to flood surrounding land)"), from the [[Sundocarme|root]] DUY (stem ''dui-'' "flow (in volume)").<ref name=HMN>{{HM|N}}, pp. 765-6</ref><ref name=VT48>{{VT|48a}}, p. 23</ref>
==Examples==
*''[[Anduin|An'''duin''']]''<ref name=VT48/>
*''[[Baranduin|Baran'''duin''']]''<ref name=VT48/>
*[[Esgalduin]]
==See also==
*[[Sindarin]] ''[[sîr]]'' ("river, stream")
*[[Quenya]] ''[[-duinë]]''
